# CI/CD Pipeline for remoteDictionary Application

**Student Name:** Shrinibas Mahanta  
**Scaler Student ID:** 23bcs10067  
**Project Title:** CI/CD Pipeline for remoteDictionary Application

GitHub Repository: [`https://github.com/2k4sm/remoteDictionary`](https://github.com/2k4sm/remoteDictionary)  
`Docker Image: https://hub.docker.com/r/sm2k4/remotedictionary`

## 1\. Problem Background & Motivation

While developing software doing things manually causes mistakes and delays.

The remoteDictionary app worked well but had no automatic way to check for errors or security problems before release. Also deployment was manual.

This project fixes that by building a full CI/CD pipeline. This pipeline automates testing, security checks, and deployment to the cloud.

## 2\. Application Overview

Remote Dictionary is a fast key-value store application.

- Type: It is a REST API service.
- Technology:
  - Code: Written in Go (Golang) version 1.24.
  - Packaging: Uses Docker to create lightweight containers.
  - Deployment: Runs on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE).

- Main Functions:
  - `POST /put`: Save or update data.
  - `GET /get`: Get data back.
  - Uses an LRU Cache to manage memory efficiently.

## 3\. CI/CD Workflow Diagram

The project uses GitHub Actions to automate the entire process from code change to production deployment.

![][image1]

## 4\. Security & Quality Controls

The pipeline adds several checks to stop bad code from getting through.

- `golangci-lint` checks the code style and finds basic errors.
- `go test` runs tests with a race detector to find concurrency bugs.
- `gosec` looks at the code to find security holes like hardcoded passwords.
- `trivy` scans the project libraries to see if any have known vulnerabilities.
- `trivy` checks the final Docker image for any OS-level issues.
- After deployment, OWASP ZAP scans the running app to check for runtime security issues.

## 5\. Results & Observations

- The system checks every code change in minutes.
- The app successfully deploys to a live Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) cluster.
- The scans found potential issues with using `alpine:latest`, showing the need for specific versions.
- The tests make sure the cache logic works correctly even when the code changes.

## 6\. Limitations & Improvements

- More tests are needed for the core logic, not just the API handlers.
- Right now, secrets are in GitHub Secrets. A better way would be to use a dedicated tool like Vault.
- The current setup checks the deployment but does not have long-term monitoring or logging setup.

## 7\. Final Conclusion

- This project successfully builds a secure and automated pipeline for the Remote Dictionary app.
- It moves from a manual process to a fully automated one using GitHub Actions, Docker, and Kubernetes.
- The result is a safer, faster, and more reliable way to deliver software.
